name: slangily
content:

in a way that uses a lot of slang expressions: She speaks far less slangily than her brother. She was slangily called "Brandy Nan" because of her love of brandy.
More examplesFewer examples"Get lost!" she retorted slangily.Many of her poems are slangily abstract in vocabulary.The hat might slangily be called a "John B".In British English "chuffed" is now mostly used slangily to mean "delighted or very pleased".
